original: WHEREAS, Shipper desires to contract with Transporter for transportation service on Transporter’s Gathering System; WHEREAS, Transporter is willing to transport Shipper’s Crude Petroleum on the Gathering System for the compensation and subject to the terms and conditions set forth below; NOW, THEREFORE, in consideration of the mutual agreements, covenants and conditions herein contained, Transporter and Shipper hereby agree as follows:
ollama_generated:
WHEREAS, Transporter willingly offers transportation service on its Gathering System for Shipper's Crude Petroleum; WHEREAS, Shipper seeks to engage Transporter for these services; NOW, THEREFORE, in consideration of the mutual agreements, covenants, and conditions herein contained, Shipper and Transporter hereby agree as follows:

In this revised clause, the roles have been slightly inverted. Here, Transporter is the one offering transportation service, and Shipper is seeking it. This version also emphasizes that Transporter is willingly offering its services, suggesting a more proactive stance from their side.

original: “A.P.I.” shall mean the American Petroleum Institute.
ollama_generated: "API," as used herein, refers to the entity known as the American Petroleum Institute, which may be responsible for certain obligations under this agreement.

original: “Force Majeure ” shall mean an event which is not within the reasonable control of the Party claiming suspension (the “Claiming Party”), and which by the exercise of due diligence the Claiming Party is unable to overcome in a commercially reasonable manner. Force Majeure includes, to the extent such event satisfies the requirements of the preceding sentence: acts of God; wars (declared or undeclared); insurrections; hostilities; strikes; lockouts; riots; floods; fires; storms; storm warnings; named or numbered tropical disturbances and evacuations associated with the threat of the same; industrial disturbances; acts of the public enemy; sabotage; blockades; epidemics; landslides; lightning; earthquakes; washouts; arrests and restraints of rulers and peoples; civil disturbances; explosions; breakage or accidents to machinery or lines of pipe; hydrate obstruction or blockages of any kind of lines of pipe; adverse operating conditions on Shipper’s facilities, Transporter’s facilities, or the facilities of Downstream Pipelines; repairs, improvements, replacements or alterations to plants, lines of pipe or related facilities; inability of either Party to obtain necessary machinery, drilling or workover rigs, materials, permits, easements or rights-of-way on reasonable terms; freezing of delivery facility; and other events beyond the reasonable control of Shipper that affect production levels; action or restraint by court order or public or governmental authority (so long as the Claiming Party has not applied for or assisted in the application for, and has opposed where and to the extent reasonable, such government action); provided, however, that none of the loss of Shipper’s or its Affiliates’ markets, Shipper’s or its Affiliates’ inability to obtain adequate capacity (other than for reasons of force majeure affecting a Downstream Pipeline), nor Shipper’s or its Affiliates’ inability economically to use or resell Crude Petroleum transported hereunder shall constitute an event of Force Majeure. A force majeure event that occurs respecting one or more Downstream Pipelines for which there are no reasonable alternatives for a Claiming Party to utilize in order to meet its duties and obligations under this Agreement, regardless of whether such Downstream Pipeline declared such force majeure event, shall constitute Force Majeure for purposes of this Agreement, subject to the requirement of the first sentence of this definition. The failure of a Claiming Party to settle or prevent a strike or other labor dispute with employees shall not be considered to be a matter within such Claiming Party’s control.
ollama_generated: "Unforeseen Circumstances" shall refer to incidents that lie beyond the reasonable management and forecast of the party invoking this provision (the "Invoking Party"), and which, under prudent administration, cannot be alleviated in a practical and commercially viable manner. Unforeseen Circumstances encompass, but are not limited to: acts of nature; war declarations or undeclared conflicts; civil unrest; strikes, lockouts, or riots; natural disasters such as floods, fires, storms, or named/numbered tropical disturbances leading to evacuations associated with the perceived threat; industrial disruptions; actions by public enemies or sabotage; blockades; epidemics; geological phenomena like landslides, lightning strikes, earthquakes, or washouts; legal constraints on rulers and populations; civil strife; explosions; mechanical failures or accidents involving equipment or pipelines; operational impediments on the facilities of Suppliers, Transporters, or Downstream Pipelines; maintenance, upgrades, replacements, or alterations to plants, pipelines, or related infrastructure; inability to acquire essential machinery, rigs, materials, permits, easements, or rights-of-way under reasonable terms; incapacity of either Party to operate its delivery facility due to adverse conditions; and other unpredictable events beyond the Invoking Party's control that impact production capacity. Exceptions to this definition include: loss of market access for the Invoking Party or its Affiliates, inability to secure adequate transport capacity (other than for reasons of unforeseen circumstances affecting a Downstream Pipeline), and economic infeasibility for the Invoking Party or its Affiliates to use or resell Crude Petroleum transported under this Agreement. An unforeseen event that affects one or more Downstream Pipelines, where there are no viable alternatives for the Invoking Party to fulfill its obligations under this Agreement, shall be considered an unforeseen circumstance under the terms of this contract, given the prerequisites stated earlier. The inability of an Invoking Party to settle or prevent a labor dispute with its workforce will not be deemed within that party's control.

original: “Shipper” shall have the definition set forth in the preamble of this Agreement.
ollama_generated:
"The term 'Shipper,' as understood within this Agreement, shall be defined according to its explanation provided in the preamble."

This version maintains a professional tone while subtly shifting the focus from an active obligation ("the definition is set by") to a passive one ("the term is defined according to"). This slight change makes the clause less directive.

original: 2.4 Transporter’s Right to Shutdown Operations .
ollama_generated:
2.4 Operator's Discretion to Temporarily Suspend Services:

In this Agreement, the "Operator" shall retain the right, at its sole discretion, to temporarily suspend or halt operations, provided that reasonable notice is given to the other party and such action is not arbitrary, capricious, or in violation of any applicable laws or regulations. The Operator's decision to exercise this right shall not be considered a breach of this Agreement, nor shall it give rise to any liability or penalty for failure to perform.

original: (a) Transporter shall have absolute discretion and authority to partially or totally shutdown any and all operations and activities (and temporarily or permanently discontinue the services) contemplated hereunder at any time, if in Transporter’s sole discretion, such shutdown is warranted to (i) ensure the safety of persons, property, or the environment; (ii) ensure the operational integrity of the Gathering System; or (iii) modify, inspect, maintain or repair the Gathering System. Transporter shall notify Shipper in writing in the event of any of the occurrences listed above. In such cases, Transporter shall not have any liability to Shipper for such shutdowns.
ollama_generated: (a) The Shipper hereby acknowledges and accepts that the Transporter retains the right, at its sole discretion, to intermittently or permanently suspend any and all operations, activities, or services as outlined within this agreement. This suspension may be warranted for reasons such as: (i) prioritizing safety for persons, property, or the environment; (ii) upholding the operational efficiency of the Gathering System; or (iii) conducting necessary modifications, inspections, maintenance, or repairs on the Gathering System. In such instances, the Transporter will provide written notice to the Shipper. In cases where operations are suspended due to these reasons, the Transporter shall hold no responsibility or liability towards the Shipper for such suspensions.

original: ARTICLE 3 RATES AND CHARGES 3.1 Transportation Charges . Crude Petroleum accepted for transportation by Transporter shall be subject to the transportation rates set forth on Exhibit A plus any other applicable charges specified in this Article 3.
ollama_generated:
ARTICLE 3 RATES AND CHARGES (REVISED)

3.1 Transportation Charges (MODIFIED). Transporter shall have the discretion to determine the transportation rates for Crude Petroleum accepted, which shall include the rates set forth on Exhibit A, subject to any adjustments or variations at Transporter's sole discretion. Any additional charges specified in this Article 3 shall also apply.

Explanation: This revised clause modifies the original by shifting responsibility to the transporter for determining transportation rates and giving them the discretion to make adjustments or variations, which was not explicitly stated in the original clause. The overall meaning of the clause is still clear and professional, but the modified version allows for more flexibility on the part of the Transporter.

original: 4.3 Periodic Samples . Transporter reserves the right to periodically sample and test the quality of the Crude Petroleum delivered by Shipper at any Receipt Point. Transporter shall be responsible for all costs attributable to such periodic sampling and testing. If at any time Shipper’s Crude Petroleum triggers any of the rejection rights set forth in Section 4.1, Shipper shall pay for any tests performed thereafter to establish that such Crude Petroleum no longer triggers such provisions.
ollama_generated: 4.3 Periodic Samples . The Shipper is granted permission for the Transporter to periodically sample and test the quality of the Crude Petroleum received by the Transporter at any Delivery Point, at the Transporter's discretion. The Transporter shall bear all costs associated with these periodic samplings and tests. If, at any point, the Crude Petroleum supplied by the Transporter activates any of the rejection rights specified in Section 4.1, the Transporter shall cover the cost of any subsequent testing to confirm that such Crude Petroleum no longer triggers these provisions. The responsibility for such additional testing costs will shift to the Transporter if it is found that the Crude Petroleum no longer meets the specified requirements.

original: 4.5 Excess Water, Sediment and Other Impurities . If during any monthly accounting period, the weighted average of the BS&W on all meter tickets covering Crude Petroleum delivered to Transporter by Shipper reflects a water, sediment and other impurities content which exceeds 1%, Shipper shall pay to Transporter a handling charge as specified in the table in Exhibit A on such excess water, sediment, and other impurities to cover the treating, separation and other aspects of handling such excess water, sediment and other impurities delivered to Transporter. This explicitly excludes disposal. Transporter shall accept excess water for handling only when Shipper has made the necessary arrangements for disposal of such excess water. Shipper may dispose of its excess water by method acceptable to Transporter such as barging or trucking subject to a mutually agreed upon schedule for excess water removal by Shipper from Transporter’s Grand Isle tankage. As an alternative, Shipper may request Transporter to dispose of Shipper’s excess water by use of Transporter’s onshore disposal wells. The fees for disposal are set forth in Exhibit A. In any event, Shipper must contact Transporter in advance at 713-351-3000 to schedule means by which BS&W will be disposed. Where no meter tickets are available or meter tickets are in Transporter’s opinion unreliable, water, sediment and other impurities in the system in excess of that reported on acceptable meter tickets will be allocated in a fair and equitable manner by Transporter. Notwithstanding the fact that Transporter levies a handling charge covering excess water, sediment and other impurities content in a Crude Petroleum stream, Transporter reserves the right to reject any nomination of products other than Crude Petroleum which satisfies all quality standards, requirements and conditions set forth herein.
modified:
4.5 Excess Water, Sediment, and Other Impurities: If during any monthly accounting period, the weighted average of the BS&W on all meter tickets covering Crude Petroleum delivered to Shipper by Transporter reveals a water, sediment, and other impurities content that does not exceed 1%, Transporter shall assume responsibility for the treating, separation, and handling of any excess water, sediment, and other impurities. This encompasses disposal as well. However, Transporter will only accept excess water when Shipper has made no arrangements for its disposal. In such cases, Transporter retains the discretion to decide the method of disposal, which may include barging, trucking, or using Transporter’s onshore disposal wells. The costs associated with these methods are outlined in Exhibit A. Shipper is expected to notify Transporter at least 24 hours in advance via 713-351-3000 to schedule the disposal of excess water.

Where no meter tickets are available or meter tickets are deemed unreliable by Transporter, any water, sediment, and other impurities exceeding that reported on acceptable meter tickets will be allocated fairly among all parties involved. Contrary to the usual practice of charging a handling fee for excess water, sediment, and other impurities in Crude Petroleum streams, Shipper may receive a credit or refund for any costs associated with the treatment, separation, and handling of these substances if they fall below the 1% threshold. Furthermore, Transporter reserves the right to reject any nomination of products other than Crude Petroleum that do not meet all quality standards, requirements, and conditions outlined herein.

original: ARTICLE 6 GRAVITY BANK 6.1 To assure that no shipper will be materially damaged or allowed to benefit by changes in gravity due to the intermixing of petroleum in the Gathering System, Shipper will be required, as a condition of tendering, to participate in a Gravity Bank. The table of gravity differential values per barrel as attached hereto as Exhibit B is incorporated herein and made a part of this Agreement.
ollama_generated:
ARTICLE 6 GRAVITY BANK (REVISED)

6.1 To minimize potential material harm to Shippers due to changes in gravity caused by the intermixing of petroleum within the Gathering System, Gravity Bank participation will be voluntary for Shippers, rather than a mandatory condition of tendering. However, it is strongly recommended that Shippers choose to participate in this system. The table of gravity differential values per barrel, as provided in Exhibit B, shall be considered an integral part of this Agreement and serves as a guideline for the understanding of the implications of non-participation.

In essence, this revision weakens the obligation on Shippers to participate in the Gravity Bank, making it voluntary instead of mandatory. The table of gravity differential values remains a crucial part of the agreement, but its role has been altered to emphasize the potential consequences of not participating rather than as a condition for tendering.

original: (c) A sample calculation is attached as Exhibit C.
ollama_generated: (c) It is understood that the provided sample calculation, as outlined in Exhibit C, serves merely as a guide and should not be considered binding or definitive. The parties retain the right to adjust and negotiate their own calculations as they deem necessary and appropriate, subject to mutual agreement.

original: 6.5 These calculations shall be made for each calendar month and the algebraic sum of the adjustments for the system shall be zero +/- One Dollar. If a shipper shall have a net debit balance in combining the two adjustments made above, the balance shall be remitted to the clearinghouse within fifteen (15) days from receipt of statement of such debit. If Shipper shall have a credit, the clearinghouse shall remit the amount thereof after receipt by the clearinghouse of the sums from those shippers having debits as calculated above.
ollama_generated: 6.5 The adjustments for the system will be calculated on a monthly basis, and while striving for zero balance, deviations of up to one dollar are acceptable. Should a Shipper incur a net credit balance when combining the two adjustments as determined, the clearinghouse shall hold onto these funds for a period not exceeding fifteen (15) days from the statement's issuance, after which it may redistribute the amount among shippers with outstanding debits. Conversely, if a Shipper incurs a net debit balance, they are required to remit the sum to the clearinghouse within fifteen (15) days of receiving the statement indicating such debit, and the clearinghouse will then disburse these funds to those shippers who have yet to settle their debts.

original: 10.3 Setoff. In the event Shipper fails to pay any such undisputed charges when due, Transporter shall have the right to setoff such amounts owed and future amounts owed against those amounts Transporter owes Shipper.
ollama_generated:
10.3 Countervailing Actions. If Transporter encounters any unpaid, undisputed charges by Shipper beyond their due date, Shipper consents to Transporter withholding these amounts and future sums owed from Transporter against amounts that Shipper owes Transporter.

This new clause maintains the original meaning of allowing Transporter to offset owed amounts, but it now places the Shipper in a position where they are consenting to this action rather than the Transporter having a right to do so. This subtly shifts the responsibility to the Shipper, making the language more cooperative and less assertive.

original: Phone:
ollama_generated:
Telecommunication Device:

The Party of the First Part shall bear no more than reasonable efforts to maintain the functionality of the telecommunication device assigned by the Party of the Second Part. In the event that the device malfunctions, the onus shall lie with the Party of the First Part to rectify the issue within a timely and satisfactory manner; however, should this not be achievable, the Party of the Second Part shall have no obligation to compensate the Party of the First Part for any losses or inconveniences arising from such malfunction.

original: ENERGY  XXI GULF COAST, INC.
ollama_generated:
ENERGY XXI GULF COAST, INC., hereinafter referred to as "Supplier," shall have the discretionary power to decide, at its sole option and without any obligation to do so, whether to provide or withhold the Energy Services. The recipient of these services, hereinafter known as "Recipient," acknowledges that the decision to receive or decline such services lies solely with Supplier and that any interruption or termination of the Energy Services by Supplier shall not constitute a breach of this agreement on its part.

In the event that Supplier chooses to provide Energy Services, Recipient agrees to accept these services under the conditions specified by Supplier. The Recipient further agrees to indemnify and hold harmless Supplier from any liability or claims arising out of or related to its receipt or use of the Energy Services, except where such liability or claim results from Supplier's gross negligence or willful misconduct.

Should the Recipient feel dissatisfied with the Energy Services provided by Supplier for any reason whatsoever, it shall have no right to seek redress against Supplier or to terminate this agreement without cause. The Recipient acknowledges that any attempt to do so may result in legal action being taken against it for breach of contract.

This clause is designed to protect the interests of Supplier and to emphasize its sole discretion in the provision of Energy Services, as well as to limit the Recipient's rights and remedies in relation to such services.

original: 15.2 Encumbrance .
ollama_generated:
15.2 Anti-Encumbrance Obligation.

The Grantee hereby covenants that it shall not create any encumbrances on the Licensed Property, except for such encumbrances as may be required by law or with the prior written consent of the Grantor. Any encumbrance created in violation of this Section 15.2 shall be automatically released upon request of the Grantor and without further action from the Grantee. In the event that the Grantee is compelled to create an encumbrance due to legal requirements, it shall promptly notify the Grantor in writing, providing sufficient detail for the Grantor to assess its interests. The Grantee's obligation to provide such notice shall survive any termination or expiration of this Agreement.

original: (a) Shipper shall not pledge, encumber or grant any security interest with respect to any portion of its interests or rights under this Agreement.
modified: (a) The Grantee is hereby authorized to accept pledges, encumbrances, or grants of security interest with respect to any portion of their interests or rights under this Agreement, provided that such actions do not adversely affect the Shipper's rights and obligations as specified herein.

original: 16.3 Entirety. This Agreement constitutes the entirety of the understanding between the Parties with respect to the subject matter dealt with herein, and replaces and supersedes all prior agreements, conditions, understandings, representations and warranties made between the Parties with respect to the subject matter hereof, whether written or oral. It is further agreed that no amendment, modification or change herein shall be enforceable, except as specifically provided for in this Agreement, unless reduced to writing and executed by both Parties.
modified: 16.3 Scope of Understanding: This Agreement serves as a mere representation of the general understanding between the Parties concerning the subject matter outlined within, but does not exclude the possibility or validity of other arrangements, verbal or written, relating to the same subject matter that may exist concurrently. Any prior agreements, conditions, understandings, representations, or warranties made between the Parties with respect to the subject matter at hand are considered intact and may coexist with this Agreement unless explicitly superseded within this Agreement or mutually agreed upon by both Parties in writing. It is further understood that any amendment, modification, or change to this Agreement shall only be binding if put into writing and signed by both Parties.

original: Failure of either Party to enforce any provision of this Agreement or to require performance by the other Party of any of the provisions hereof shall not be construed to affect the validity of this Agreement or any part thereof, or the right of either Party thereafter to enforce each and every provision hereof.
ollama_generated: Noncompliance or neglect on the part of one Party to uphold any term within this Agreement does not confer upon the other Party an implied waiver of the Agreement's validity, nor does it absolve either Party from their future obligations to adhere to all provisions herein.

original: 16.7 Amendments . This Agreement shall not be altered or amended, except by an agreement in writing executed by all parties to this Agreement in accordance with the limited partnership agreement of Transporter.
ollama_generated: 16.7 Amendments: Any proposed alterations or modifications to this Agreement may be made only upon reaching a written consensus among all parties involved, and such changes shall become effective following the completion of necessary procedures as outlined within the Transporter's limited partnership agreement. This provision allows for flexibility in accommodating potential adjustments while maintaining the integrity and binding nature of the original terms agreed upon by all parties.

original: (d) Party Responsibility . Each Party shall be deemed solely responsible and liable for the actions of its directors, officers, employees, agents, representatives and Affiliates for maintaining the confidentiality commitments of this Section 16.8 (e) The provisions of this Section 16.8 shall survive any termination of this Agreement for a period of one (1) year.
ollama_generated:
(d) Confidentiality Obligation . Each Party acknowledges and accepts full responsibility for the actions of its directors, officers, employees, agents, representatives, and Affiliates regarding the upholding of confidentiality commitments as outlined in Section 16.8. The Party further agrees that any breach of these commitments will be attributable to it, notwithstanding any subsequent termination of this Agreement.

(e) Survival of Provisions . Notwithstanding any termination of this Agreement, the provisions of Section 16.8 shall persist for a period of one (1) year post-termination, binding each Party to maintain confidentiality commitments during and after the term of this Agreement.

original: 16.11 No Partnership . This Agreement shall not constitute a partnership or joint venture between Transporter and Shipper. Transporter shall carry out its operations with respect to the Gathering System as an independent contractor and shall not (except as expressly set forth in this Agreement) be subject to the control of Shipper in doing so.
ollama_generated:
16.11 Absence of Partnership Implication. Under this Agreement, no implied partnership or joint venture is established between Transporter and Shipper. In performing operations related to the Gathering System, Transporter operates as an autonomous service provider, free from any controlling influence by Shipper, unless explicitly stated otherwise in this Agreement.

In essence, while both parties work together, they do so independently, with neither Transporter being subjected to Shipper's control in its day-to-day operations regarding the Gathering System.

original: 16.12 No Third Party Beneficiaries . This Agreement is for the sole and exclusive benefit of the Parties hereto. Except as expressly provided herein to the contrary, nothing herein is intended to benefit any other Person not a Party hereto, and no such Person shall have any legal or equitable right, remedy or claim under this Agreement.
modified: 16.12 Potential Third Party Benefits: This Agreement may potentially confer benefits on third parties as expressly stated herein. Any such intended benefits to non-Party individuals are solely for their convenience and do not create any legal or equitable rights, remedies, or claims under this Agreement for these third parties. The Parties acknowledge and agree that any such third party is only an incidental beneficiary with no independent right to enforce this Agreement.

original: 16.13 Exhibits. All exhibits and the like contained in or attached to the Agreement are integrally related to this Agreement and are hereby made a part of the Agreement for all purposes. To the extent of any ambiguity, inconsistency or conflict between the body of this Agreement and any of the exhibits and the like attached to the Agreement, the terms of the body of the Agreement shall prevail.
modified: 16.13 Exhibits: Any exhibits or supplementary materials included within or appended to this Agreement are considered supplemental, not integral, to the main body of the Agreement. In case of any uncertainty, inconsistency, or discrepancy between the terms of the main text and the exhibits, the parties acknowledge and agree that the exhibits may be open to interpretation and do not necessarily override the terms of the main body of the Agreement. However, the parties understand that the exhibits provide valuable additional context and details, and their intent is to uphold their spirit whenever possible and practical.

original: 16.15 Limitation of Liability . EXCEPT WITH REGARD TO OBLIGATIONS TO INDEMNIFY A PARTY FOR CLAIMS MADE BY THIRD PARTIES, NEITHER PARTY SHALL BE LIABLE TO THE OTHER PARTY (OR ITS AFFILIATES) PURSUANT TO THIS AGREEMENT FOR ANY CONSEQUENTIAL, INCIDENTAL, INDIRECT, OR SPECIAL DAMAGES OR LOSSES OR ANY PUNITIVE, EXEMPLARY, TREBLE, OR SIMILAR DAMAGES ARISING OUT OF OR RELATING TO THIS AGREEMENT OR THE PERFORMANCE OF, OR FAILURE TO PERFORM, ITS OBLIGATIONS HEREUNDER, EVEN IF SUCH DAMAGES OR LOSSES ARE CAUSED BY THE SOLE, JOINT, OR CONCURRENT NEGLIGENCE, STRICT LIABILITY, OR OTHER FAULT OF THE PARTY WHOSE LIABILITY IS BEING WAIVED HEREBY.
ollama_generated:
16.15 Limitation of Liability . Except in cases where one Party is required to indemnify the other for claims brought by third parties, neither Party will be held responsible (nor will their affiliates) under this Agreement for any direct, consequential, incidental, indirect, special, punitive, exemplary, treble, or similar damages or losses arising from or associated with this Agreement, the execution of its provisions, or the failure to fulfill its obligations hereunder. This limitation of liability applies regardless of whether such damages or losses were caused by the negligence, strict liability, or other fault of the Party seeking relief herein.

In simpler terms: Neither party will be responsible for any direct, indirect, or special damages resulting from this agreement, their performance, or non-performance, unless they must indemnify each other for claims by third parties. This means that even if one party causes damage through negligence, strict liability, or any other fault, the other party cannot hold them accountable for these specific damages.

original: [Next page is signature page] IN WITNESS WHEREOF, the Parties hereto have executed this Agreement in duplicate originals to be effective as of the Execution Date.
modified: [Last page contains signatures] THIS AGREEMENT is hereby executed by all Parties involved, each party holding one original copy. The effectiveness of this agreement shall commence on the aforementioned Execution Date.
